abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated as
            unsatisfactory. Except for the service delivery component,
            the sustainability of activities for institutional
            development, community partnership, and operations research
            is unlikely. Bank performance improved from 1998, when
            supervision was handed over to the resident mission, and a
            new task manager developed a more productive working
            relationship, and assisted with the project restructuring.
            By this time also, the resident mission had developed a
            capacity to assist the health department with training and
            technical assistance. But despite these improvements later
            in project implementation, overall Bank performance is rated
            as unsatisfactory. Borrower performance also is rated
            unsatisfactory overall. Nevertheless it was far better in
            its last two years than in its first four, mainly because a
            full-time project manager wa sappointed, project
            restructuring helped the project management office get some
            of the basic planning done, and progress was made in
            strengthening capacity and clarifying procedures. Lessons
            learned included the need to resolve cross-cutting and
            fundamental management problems first; identify and respond
            to major changes likely to affect the implementing agency;
            encourage the Borrower to maintain a professional project
            management office; and create true project ownership; and
            for task manager continuity, supervision in the crucial
            first project year, replacement of ineffective task managers.
